block.p: * Abraham & Straus, New York, a division of Federated Department Stores Inc., named Robert Reichenbach senior vice president/general merchandise manager of its home division. The company also named Dennis Zezas senior vice president of engineering and operations. * Airco, Murray Hill, N.J., a member of the BOC Group that manufactures industrial gases, promoted Madeline Moore to vice president of sales for its carbon dioxide division. * Coopers & Lybrand, the New York-based accounting firm, named Harris J. Amhowitz a deputy chairman. He will remain the firm's general counsel. * ICM Property Investors Inc., New York, named Constance B. Moore president and chief operating officer. She succeeds Arthur W. Viner, who will continue as chairman and chief executive. * McDonnell Douglas Missile Systems Co., St. Louis, a division of McDonnell Douglas Corp., named Dr. Rodney M. Linford and Dr. James B. Peterson vice presidents. * Max Factor & Co., Los Angeles, a subsidiary of the Revlon Group Inc., promoted Elaine Esposito to vice president of the merchandisers' division. * Rockwell International Corp., El Segundo, Calif., named Charles B. Harrison vice president of advanced technology in its defense electronics organization. * Saks Fifth Avenue, New York, named Brian E. Kendrick senior vice president and chief financial officer. * Wertheim Schroder & Co., New York, named Scott C. Marden a managing director in its New York office.
